tests.name: only key column - select star
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by ID;

tests.name: single value column - select star
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING, AGE INT) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by NAME;

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: NAME STRING KEY, AGE INT, ID INT

tests.name: struct field - select star
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, ADDRESS STRUCT<STREET STRING, TOWN STRING>, AGE INT) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by ADDRESS->TOWN;

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: TOWN STRING KEY, ADDRESS STRUCT<STREET STRING, TOWN STRING>, AGE INT, ID INT

tests.name: struct field - select duplicate
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, ADDRESS STRUCT<STREET STRING, TOWN STRING>, AGE INT) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select ADDRESS->TOWN from INPUT partition by ADDRESS->TOWN;

expectedException.message: Value column name(s) `TOWN` clashes with key column name(s)

tests.name: expression - select star
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by ABS(ID);

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: KSQL_COL_0 INT KEY, NAME STRING, ID INT

tests.name: only key column - select columns
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING, OTHER INT) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT NAME FROM INPUT PARTITION BY ID;

tests.name: only key column - select star - with join on keys
statements: CREATE STREAM L (A INT KEY, B INT, C INT) WITH (kafka_topic='LEFT', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM R (X INT KEY, Y INT, Z INT) WITH (kafka_topic='RIGHT', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT * FROM L JOIN R WITHIN 10 SECONDS ON L.A = R.X PARTITION BY L.B;

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: L_B INT KEY, L_C INT, L_ROWTIME BIGINT, L_A INT, R_Y INT, R_Z INT, R_ROWTIME BIGINT, R_X INT

tests.name: only key column - select star - with join on value columns
statements: CREATE STREAM L (A INT KEY, B INT, C INT) WITH (kafka_topic='LEFT', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM R (X INT KEY, Y INT, Z INT) WITH (kafka_topic='RIGHT', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT * FROM L JOIN R WITHIN 10 SECONDS ON L.B = R.Y PARTITION BY A;

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: L_A INT KEY, L_B INT, L_C INT, L_ROWTIME BIGINT, R_Y INT, R_Z INT, R_ROWTIME BIGINT, R_X INT

tests.name: nulls
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ROWKEY BIGINT KEY, ID bigint, NAME varchar) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'delimited');
CREATE STREAM REPARTITIONED AS select id from TEST partition by name;

tests.name: single column - with alias
comment: Note: as the partition by is aliased, it is treated as a new column and the 'select *'
expansion still includes 'NAME'. Where as without the alias it would not.
This can be through of as similar to `SELECT *, NAME as NEW KEY FROM'.
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING, AGE INT) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by NAME AS NEW_KEY;

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: NEW_KEY STRING KEY, NAME STRING, AGE INT, ID INT

tests.name: only key column - with alias that matches key column
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING, OTHER INT) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT NAME FROM INPUT PARTITION BY ID AS ID;

tests.name: single non-key column - with alias that matches old key column
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING, AGE INT) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by NAME AS ID;

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: ID STRING KEY, NAME STRING, AGE INT

tests.name: single expression - with alias
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING, AGE INT) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by UCASE(NAME) AS NEW_KEY;

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: NEW_KEY STRING KEY, NAME STRING, AGE INT, ID INT

tests.name: with alias that matches source column
comment: if the alias matches a source column name the new key _replaces_ that column.
this is preferable to failing, which would stop users performing otherwise value repartitioning
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING, AGE INT) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select NAME, ID from INPUT partition by NAME AS AGE;

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: AGE STRING KEY, NAME STRING, ID INT

tests.name: complex expressions
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING, AGE INT) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by NAME AND AGE;

tests.name: partition by with projection select some
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID bigint, NAME varchar, VALUE bigint) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'delimited');
CREATE STREAM REPARTITIONED AS select id from TEST partition by name;

tests.name: int column
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ROWKEY STRING KEY, ID bigint) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'delimited');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT * from TEST partition by id;

tests.name: bigint key field
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ROWKEY BIGINT KEY, ID BIGINT) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'delimited', key='ID');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from TEST partition by ID;

tests.name: partition by - KAFKA
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID int) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format = 'KAFKA');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select ROWKEY from INPUT partition by ID;

tests.name: partition by with projection select all
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID bigint, NAME varchar, VALUE bigint) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'delimited');
CREATE STREAM REPARTITIONED AS select * from TEST partition by name;

tests.name: partition by with null value
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ROWKEY BIGINT KEY, ID bigint, NAME varchar, VALUE bigint) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'delimited', key='ID');
CREATE STREAM REPARTITIONED AS select * from TEST partition by name;

tests.name: partition by with null partition by value
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID bigint, NAME varchar, VALUE bigint) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'delimited');
CREATE STREAM REPARTITIONED AS select * from TEST partition by name;

tests.name: aliased key field - different name
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID varchar, NAME varchar) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'delimited', key='ID');
CREATE STREAM REPARTITIONED AS select ID + '_new' AS ID_new, NAME from TEST partition by ID_NEW;

expectedException.message: Line: 5, Col: 14: PARTITION BY column 'TEST.ID_NEW' cannot be resolved.

tests.name: partition by project ROWKEY
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID bigint) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select ROWKEY AS OLDKEY from INPUT partition by ID;

tests.name: partition by ROWKEY
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID bigint) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by ROWKEY;

tests.name: partition by only key column
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by ID;

tests.name: partition by ROWTIME
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID bigint) with (kafka_topic='input', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS select * from INPUT partition by ROWTIME as RT;

tests.name: partition by ROWKEY in join on ROWKEY
statements: CREATE STREAM L (A STRING, B STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='LEFT', value_format='JSON', KEY='A');
CREATE STREAM R (C STRING, D STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='RIGHT', value_format='JSON', KEY='C');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT L.ROWKEY AS LK, R.ROWKEY FROM L JOIN R WITHIN 10 SECONDS ON L.A = R.C PARTITION BY L.ROWKEY;

tests.name: partition by ROWKEY in join on non-ROWKEY
statements: CREATE STREAM L (A STRING, B STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='LEFT', value_format='JSON', KEY='A');
CREATE STREAM R (C STRING, D STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='RIGHT', value_format='JSON', KEY='C');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT L.ROWKEY AS LK, R.ROWKEY FROM L JOIN R WITHIN 10 SECONDS ON L.B = R.D PARTITION BY L.ROWKEY;

tests.name: partition by ROWKEY in join on ROWKEY ALIASED
statements: CREATE STREAM L (A STRING, B STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='LEFT', value_format='JSON', KEY='A');
CREATE STREAM R (C STRING, D STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='RIGHT', value_format='JSON', KEY='C');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT L.ROWKEY, R.ROWKEY FROM L JOIN R WITHIN 10 SECONDS ON L.A = R.C PARTITION BY L.A;

tests.name: partition by non-ROWKEY in join on ROWKEY
statements: CREATE STREAM L (A STRING, B STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='LEFT', value_format='JSON', KEY='A');
CREATE STREAM R (C STRING, D STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='RIGHT', value_format='JSON', KEY='C');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT L.ROWKEY, R.ROWKEY FROM L JOIN R WITHIN 10 SECONDS ON L.A = R.C PARTITION BY L.B;

tests.name: partition by non-ROWKEY in join on non-ROWKEY
statements: CREATE STREAM L (A STRING, B STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='LEFT', value_format='JSON', KEY='A');
CREATE STREAM R (C STRING, D STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='RIGHT', value_format='JSON', KEY='C');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT L.ROWKEY, R.ROWKEY FROM L JOIN R WITHIN 10 SECONDS ON L.B = R.D PARTITION BY L.B;

tests.name: only key column
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT * FROM INPUT PARTITION BY ID;

tests.name: should handled quoted key and value
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (`Key` STRING KEY, `Name` STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT *, `Name` AS `Name2` FROM INPUT PARTITION BY `Key`;

tests.name: nulls using coalesce
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID BIGINT KEY, NAME varchar) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'json');
CREATE STREAM REPARTITIONED AS select id from TEST partition by COALESCE(name, 'default');

tests.name: should handle PARTITION BY that throws
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID bigint, shouldThrow BOOLEAN) with (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format = 'json');
CREATE STREAM REPARTITIONED AS select ID from TEST partition by bad_udf(shouldThrow);
